result.execSummary:
All charges against Sadiki Fadal Johnson II in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sadiki Fadal Johnson II is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sadiki Fadal Johnson II

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Sadiki F Johnson not in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss. Motion of defense is granted. Court ordered case dismissed without prejudice.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail, filed

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Sadiki Fadal Johnson not in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is taken under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sadiki Fadal Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a prleiminary hearing. Attorney Robert Hampton will be appointed pending a conflit check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Sadiki Fadal Johnson in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Sadiki Fadal Johnson in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sadiki Fadal Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
